results.title: Pentimento
results.material_description: interactive software, video, infra red lights and projection
results.brief_description: PENTIMENTO is based on real events which took place in the Blue Mountains on the outskirts of Sydney, during 1999, involving the discovery of an unidentified body. It fictionalizes these events to dramatize some of the key elements surrounding the murder and the sexual violence which formed its backdrop. It presents these events in the form of recollections from the point of view of a father, sister, brother and the crime scene itself.

results.title: VNS Matrix: The Cyberfeminist Manifesto for the 21st Century

constellations_other.name: Future forward; cyberpunk manifestations, fantasy and world building
constellations_other.description: Science fiction and more specially cyberpunk narratives are often powerful projections of the future, some may act as dystopic warnings of what is to come and others strive for an optimistic outcome where societies rise above all adversity.

results.title_for_label: VNS Matrix: The Cyberfeminist Manifesto for the 21st Century
results.description: In 1991, VNS Matrix unleashed their collaborative manifesto A Cyberfeminist Manifesto for the 21st Century. They put it on the internet and a giant travelling billboard. From there, it quickly leaked onto the radio and magazine pages and other IRL ephemera, jumping from medium to medium at rapid pace, eventually coming to rest in the centre of a 6m x 3m billboard, flanked by speculative/fantastical icons, in the form of a futuristic sigil. It was in this gyne-canonical text that the term “cyberfeminism” first appeared.
description_for_label: In 1991, VNS Matrix unleashed their collaborative manifesto A Cyberfeminist Manifesto for the 21st Century. They put it on the internet and a giant travelling billboard. From there, it quickly leaked onto the radio and magazine pages and other IRL ephemera, jumping from medium to medium at rapid pace, eventually coming to rest in the centre of a 6m x 3m billboard, flanked by speculative/fantastical icons, in the form of a futuristic sigil. It was in this gyne-canonical text that the term “cyberfeminism” first appeared.

results.title: The Girl from Tomorrow. Ep 1-3
results.creator_credit: Noel Price, Film Australia, Nine Network and Kathy Mueller
results.brief_description: Alana, a lively 13 year old from the year 3000, finds herself stranded in a strange and primitive world when a time-travel experiment goes terribly wrong. She is kidnapped by Silverthorn, a fugitive war-lord from the dangerous and violent times of the year 2500 and they crash land in a rubbish dump in Sydney in the year 1990. Alana crawls from the battered time capsule, leaving Silverthorn unconscious, and escapes with her personal wrist computer P.J. as her only companion. Cold, hungry and frightened, she is discovered by Jenny, a rebellious purple-haired girl her own age and Petey, Jenny’s science fiction obsessed younger brother.

constellations_other.name: Retrofuturism: aesthetic impact of space design on screen culture
constellations_other.description: Humans have long imagined the future, including prospective travel to space and what living life away from planet earth could look like. This extending to designing interiors of domestic spaces and how they have influenced screen culture.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Noel Price, Film Australia, Nine Network and Kathy Mueller

results.title: The Animals of Farthing Wood
results.creator_credit: John Mills, Philippe LeClerc, Elphin Lloyd-Jones, BBC and EBU
results.brief_description: This is a series of animated films about the animals of Farthing Wood and their journey. They set off on a very long journey, full of adventure and excitement. Based on the bestselling books of Colin Dann.

constellations_other.name: Make it cute, make them think
constellations_other.description: Cartoons and anime are known for their dynamic and vibrant visuals, but beneath the cuteness they can also deliver powerful environmental messages and address the climate crisis.

results.creator_credit_for_label: John Mills, Philippe LeClerc, Elphin Lloyd-Jones, BBC and EBU
results.description: This is a series of animated films about the animals of Farthing Wood and their journey. Kestrel brings news that the humans are filling in the pond, and with no source of water, they would surely die. Toad advises that they should head for the nature reserve at White Deer Park. They set off on a very long journey, full of adventure and excitement. Based on the bestselling books of Colin Dann.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Warrnambool veterans]
results.brief_description: Fourteen veterans tell their stories, from the Australian Army, the Royal Australian Navy, and the Royal Australian Air Force. They share their memories from World War II, the Korean and Vietnam Wars and from the Australian home front. Ten stories from and four interviews with Victorian veterans based in Port Fairy and Warnambool.

results.title: Spuds again
results.brief_description: Irrespresible and cheeky, Avis Quarrell was an avid church goer but liked nothing more than making fun of her superiors. One particular day landed her in hot water and back to peeling spuds.

results.title: A Secret war room
results.creator_credit: Joan Peck, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Joan Peck served in the WAAAF as a radio telephone operator at Number one fighter sector in Preston. Their main role was to connect the army, navy and airforce in one central control to help protect and defend the Victorian coastline. Peck used state of the art technology at work, yet didn’t even have a telephone at home. Her highly secretive and crucial work at the centre was often interspersed with a spot of knitting.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joan Peck, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Over in 3 weeks
results.creator_credit: Tom Ross, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Once Tom Ross and his fellow soldiers settled in Singapore, the bombing started. In three weeks, they were captured and sent to Changi, where Ross was a prisoner of war for three and a half years. Despite the abject conditions, Ross managed to survive through sheer determination and will to live.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Ross, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My brother's birthday
results.creator_credit: Max Hammond, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In Syria, on the way to Beirut, Max Hammond’s thoughts turned to his family. One of seven children, Hammond and his three brothers served together in World War II. He recounts a close call that occurred on his brother’s birthday and reflects on how lucky he and his brothers are.
